action.action-desc: Mr. Roy (for himself, Mr. Webster of Florida, Mr. Norman, Ms. Boebert, and Mr. Ogles) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Armed Services

form.official-title: To eliminate the position of the Chief Diversity Officer of the Department of Defense, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Restoring Military Focus Act.

section.header: Elimination of the Chief Diversity Officer of the Department of Defense

subsection.text: Section 147 of title 10, United States Code, is repealed.
Section 913 of the William M. (Mac) Thornberry National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2021 (Public Law 116–283; 134 Stat. 3802) is repealed.

section.header: Prohibition on establishment of similar positions
section.text: No Federal funds may be obligated or expended to establish a position within the Department of Defense that is the same as or substantially similar to—

paragraph.text: the position of Chief Diversity Officer, as described in section 147 of title 10, United States Code, as such section was in effect before the date of the enactment of this Act; or

the position of Senior Advisor for Diversity and Inclusion, as described in section 913(b) of the William M. (Mac) Thornberry National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2021 (Public Law 116–283; 134 Stat. 3803), as such section was in effect before the date of the enactment of this Act.
